newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Leighton says announcement due soon.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Leighton says announcement due soon.

text.p: Leighton Holdings Ltd chief executive Wal King said on Tuesday that the company would make an announcement soon, but he would not give any further details.
"We're going to announce something in the next couple of days," King told Reuters when asked about the sharp rise in Leighton share price to a fresh high of A$5.60 earlier on Tuesday.
"It's something we're doing here and overseas," he said.
He would not give any other details.
One Sydney-based construction analyst said Leighton is bidding on several contracts in Australia and overseas.
"They have their irons in lots of fires," the analyst told Reuters. "There are a number of interesting contracts, particularly on the contract mining side."
He said Leighton, which is 44.9 percent owned by German construction group Hochtief Ag, is also bidding for some contracts in Thailand and Malaysia.
At 4.00 p.m. (0600 GMT), Leighton shares were 32 cents or 6.04 percent up at a record high of A$5.62 on light volume.
The analyst said Leighton shares have been rising strongly since the Sydney-based group last month reported a 37 percent rise in net profit to A$70.21 million for the year ended June 30.
